title: Font Help!
content:
Hi there! Can anyone help me identify this font? I hope you can see it clearly, the are down turns and up turns at the points of some of the letters.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724102915/http:/typophile.com/files/image_115.jpg) | 212.77 KB |
author: Primehunter

comments.content:
Can you tell us anything about the age of the sample, and where it is used? Are there any other letters that can help prove it is a font? These three letters are not much to use for ID purposes.

- Mike yanega

In looking for this I found a similar font that might be the answer: [ITC Symbol Black Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724102915/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/symbol/?refby=bowfin). At least it seemed close to my eyes. Your sample looks like a tiny serif style, and that was how I searched for it.

- Mike Yanega

It must be **[ITC Goudy Sans Black (Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724102915/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=ITC&ffam=ITC%20Goudy%20Sans%20Black%20-%20Italic&fid=123bd9fb00542b9f1e339ce1fe8516fe&fsize=60&text=ZOOM&fit=1)** by Frederic W. Goudy [1929], published by ITC on 1986  
The sample looks a bit expanded
